thread.title: Bank of Canada keeps key rate on hold at 0.5 per cent as resource sector adjusts
thread.title_full: Bank of Canada keeps key rate on hold at 0.5 per cent as resource sector adjusts - Winnipeg Free Press

author: The Canadian Press
title: Bank of Canada keeps key rate on hold at 0.5 per cent as resource sector adjusts
text:
The Bank of Canada is keeping its key interest rate on hold at 0.5 per cent and says the resource sector continues to adjust to lower prices for oil and other commodities.
The central bank says economic activity continues to be underpinned by household spending and a firm economic recovery in the United States.

The Bank of Canada is seen in Ottawa on September 6, 2011. The Bank of Canada is scheduled to make its latest pronouncements on the economy and interest rates later this morning. The consensus of economists is that the central bank will keep its trend-setting policy rate unchanged at 0.5 per cent. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Sean Kilpatrick 
However, it noted that increased uncertainty about growth in China and other emerging markets is raising questions about the pace of the global recovery. It says the uncertainty is contributing to volatility on the financial markets.
The Bank of Canada says inflation has "evolved in line" with its expectations in the July monetary policy report and has remained near the bottom end of the target range, due to the drop in energy prices.
However core inflation, which excludes some of the most volatile items, has been close to the bank's two per cent target due to the drop in the Canadian dollar and some sector-specific factors.
